comment:
Strongly recommend to start assignments early. His wording on assignments can be awkward. If you're stuck, do email him. He provides good feedback. 
The assignments, are not  difficult in that he provides a lot of the code and you add to it. Personally, I learned from his example codes and seeing how changing parameters affect the output.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: For most of the assignments he gives you most of the code and gives you instructions on  how the file code should look like. Always gives feedback on everything so you know what you need to work on. Overall great class.

CS 4722, The Book differ his lecture, the methodologist of the book and the methodologist of his website are different so that you have a problem for learning, unprofessional structure of his own web that is set off the university website, his examples of code are imprecise, tangles, messes, very disorganized, you don't want to take this guy.

Has his own website that he goes by, which contains all of his assignments. The assignments are 50% of your grade so its best to manage your time wisely and not wait until the last minute. Tests are super easy if you know the assignments. Emails back in about two business days. You can pass this class easily if you are willing to put time into it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: He doesn't use the school resources for the online material, and opts to use his own site instead. All his own material, examples, references, etc. This feels amateurish and awkward then for a college course, and like I'm paying for a youtube guru or something. This same class even covers diff. material some semesters. It's not consistent.

Pretty nice guy. His lecture style is a bit boring. He is very willing to answer questions. He puts everything online including lecture recordings, so you don't have to come to class, except for exams. Only reason why I am not giving him a 5 is because some of his assignments did not make sense the way he wrote them and he would change them often.

Knowledgeable, but not much trying to teach. No textbook; everything is on his website. Very unorganized and confusing. Lecture heavy. Inadvertently deletes student emails, so good luck trying to get hold of him after class hours. Willing to help after class, but time is extremely limited. Be ready to teach yourself everything! Don't recommend.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Doesn't teach from a textbook and it's very hard to learn from his lectures, but he's SUCH a nice guy that I can't even drag him for terrible teaching. Gives a lot of work with a lot of grades, but as long as you do well on labs you should be fine. May not even teach this course again as we were his first class for the course number.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Honestly Professor Setzer was amazing. He would give you note cards to write down information to have on test days. He cares about his students and does not rush the learning process. A true hero.

he gives us 10 minutes at the end of every class to do a pop quiz. his tests are nothing like the homework. we correct him. majority of the time when he's teaching class because he cannot teach problems on our level. he writes things on the board that you can't even read bc it looks like chicken scratch. unless math is easy for you, don't take him.

Doesn't know how to explain things when people ask, can't finish his own thoughts, gets jumbled up super easily, quizzes almost everyday so you can't skip, does problems without explanation, and doesn't know how to tell you how he even did them. Most confusing professor I have ever had.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Can't teach on a basic level, doesn't make any sense, gets lost in his own thoughts, confusing and doesn't explain how he gets his answers, does everything in his head, random pop quizzes almost everyday and sometimes they don't relate to the current info taught.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I took Prof Setzer for MATH 1111. His lectures can be very very boring but he makes a very strong effort to ensure everyone understands that concepts before moving on. He is not afraid to take time out in order to make sure everyone is on the same page. Super friendly and cares about student success, just a little boring in class.

He's a really really great professor. If you are ever having trouble on a particular assignment or program he will help you in any way possible. As others have pointed out, he will give you pointers on how to improve your code. Tests were not easy, but they are open note and open book. DO NOT SKIP CLASS unless of course you're really good at coding

Wonderful class and professor. Unlike the prof for 2301,  Dr. Setzer actually explains the concepts behind programming and makes it clear. He really needs to be the main prof of 2301 as well. All testsquizzes are open note, and he records everything so you can go back a listen if you miss anything. Very accessible prof who wants you to do well.

This Internet Programming course was great!  Most of it was Python and I really enjoyed it. Learning quite a bit. Lectures were a bit dull but tests derived directly from lectures, no surprises. Major project do-able but requires time investment. Previous prog and Linux experience a plus for this course.

Lectures can get boring; it's an almost 3 hour class. Prof. Setzer is a great Professor; you really can't hate the guy because he genuinely cares about your success. He literally went 1 by 1 to everyone during labs to see where we were at - he will hold off labs if the entire class is struggling.  He's the reason I will continue in my major.

He undid everything wrong my previous CS teacher brainwashed me with. He really knows what he is doing and is extremely kind when it comes to helping you with personal questions. He has been teaching at KSU for more than half the time it has been open and is a good grader, giving partial credit. He really wants you to do well in the class. TAKE HIM

He’s a good teacher, cares that his students doing well. Gives you a study guide before tests- which are open book. Gives quizzes and assignments that both count towards the final grade...Fairly easy course. I’d take him again. I strongly recommend Prof Setzer!

This class was about exploring mathematical concepts using Java. There are no tests, just 7 homework assignments due every two weeks. Everything, including the lectures, is online so there is no actual class to attend. The assignments are straightforward but sometimes he takes off lots of points for little things. He allows resubmissions though.

I really enjoyed this class. The labs are wicked easy and the almost always coincide with what we learned that day in class. Every test is open note and you can even ask him questions about the problems. He always answered my questions about the assignments as well. Great prof! Great class!

He is a great teacher! Very helpful if you have any questions. Very knowledgeable on the subject. Lectures were a little dull but if you wanted to skip them and just come in for the lab you could. I would recommend him to anyone taking any CS classes.

If I could take every CS course with Prof. Setzer, I would in a heartbeat. The man -gets- teaching -- it's not about tripping your students up, it's about ensuring they learn. Prof. Setzer does just that -- he even delayed and then cancelled a test because he felt he hadn't adequately prepared us for it. Tests open-book/notes, GREAT guy.

His lectures are boring but he is extremely laid back, accessible, accommodating, and helpful. Tests are open notes and open book. Homework is easy but helps you learn. He assigned a big project in the beginning but pared it back so much that is was basically a glorified homework assignment. I would take every course with him if I could.

his guy lectures are all over the place. He constantly change back and forth between slides; so listen to his recordings. He is boring! The work is easy and test are open book; however, they are wordy and confusing. So open book test are not easy. The web page assignment was a wase of time, because he do not make clear on the instructions.

Amazing course by Dr. Setzer (Distributed Systems Development, Summer '09). Over 4 weeks, we covered months worth of material, but it was covered well. Loved the class and the topics-- was a refreshing change! I highly recommend Setzer as a professor.

Class is very boring and he turns the lights off which makes it worse: you almost fall asleep. Be careful if you like to skip classes because he gives pop quizzes that count for class participation. You do learn a lot with him though.
Have yet to meet a professor near as helpful and accommodating as Setzer. If you do poorly in this guy's class, you have only yourself to blame.

I took Dr Setzer for IS 2101 and this class was really easy.  I went to class everyday but it probably wasn't necessary.  He recorded the lectures and put them and the Powerpoints online.  If you do well on the tests and do the homeworks and assignments this class is an easy A.
Excellent Professor

Mr. Setzer is one of the most knowledgeable people in the CS department.  He is very patient with students.  His course is fairly challenging but by no means difficult.  He gives lots of easy in class assignments which help boost grades.  I would recommend him.

I really enjoyed Dr. Setzer's programming class.  He responded very well to students' questions, and patiently explained the answers.  Overall, he is very serious, but he does have a sense of humor.  He took a poke at us for our lack of mathematical skills, then took a shot at himself for being arrogant.
extremely knowledgeable about the field and patient with students who have no idea about technology.

Ben Setzer is by far one of the BEST assets at KSU! He is a great professor and a great Academic Advisor. Whenever I had problems with assignments or understanding principles, he was willing to help.  He is readily available and returns email within 24hr. When I needed help with transfer credits he was able to help get things done. A+++ in my book!
Dr. Setzer was a fantastic teacher and great advisor. If there were many more like him, the state of education in this country would not be as poor as it is.

Great Professor, very helpful and classes are interesting.  Very FARE.  I would recommend taking him for everything.  Tests are open book and Fare.  He is learn to help you learn not beat you up with rediculous tests.
This man is a genius, yet he has the gift of explaining things on a simple level. He answers even the dumbest questions with great respect. One of the better professors I've ever had.
One of the best in the csis dept. I would definately take him again!!
Good professor! Will take his class again!
Helpful.  Covers material until he is comformtable that most of the classroom is on course.  Answers all questions without hesitation.  Would take a course with this professor again.
Good teacher, and yes some people fall sleep in his class. You get a lot of help from him if you ask. I recomend this teacher.
Boring; half of the clas fell asleep daily, all tests and quizes open book.
